name: Luangwa River Camp - Robin Pope Safaris
description: The South Luangwa National Park marks the end of the Great Rift Valley, one of the last remaining unspoilt wilderness areas and possibly the finest wildlife sanctuary in Africa. It is through this that the great meandering Luangwa river runs, with its ox bow lagoons, riverine supported woodlands and large plains, all of which play host to huge concentrations of game including elephant, buffalo, leopard, lion, giraffe, hippo and over 450 species of birds. Luangwa River Camp sits nestled under an ancient ebony grove on the banks of the Luangwa River overlooking the game rich area known as the Luangwa Wafwa. This small and intimate camp with just five bush suites, along with its setting and location creates a real “wow” factor and a romantic feeling simply flows through the camp. The subtly decorated bush suites with brick walls and thatch roof each have ensuite bathrooms with sunken bathtubs looking out onto your own private corner of Africa. Both the bedroom and bathroom are afronted with large sliding doors leading onto a decked area allowing a lovely breeze into the room and great views onto the river. The main area stretches over various elevated decked levels amongst which a tempting double plunge pool with a waterfall linking the two is situated. Seating areas around the pool or in the shade of the open plan bar on the highest level all offer uninterrupted views across the river and into the National Park. Luangwa River Camp offers all the creature comforts of a lodge yet retains the intimacy and privacy of a bush camp.
address: Plot 8553 Mfuwe, South Luangwa National Park E6 Zambia

Perched on the tip of the Siansowa peninsula, we have much to offer. A wide range of accommodation from guesthouses and en-suite chalets to houseboats and camping gives everyone a chance to appreciate this small slice of African paradise. Spend your days wallowing in our pool overlooking Kariba or wine and dine with family and friends in our lake-view restaurant; roast tomato soup, homemade cheese ravioli, fresh kariba bream and exotic crocodile curry are just a few dishes on offer. Activities available include scenic sunset/dinner cruises, island walking safaris, fishing, bird watching and exhilarating tours of Zambia’s largest crocodile farm.Our private islands on Kariba provide clients with a perfect game viewing experience; wildlife to be seen includes eland, kudu, sable, zebra, wildebeest, defasa waterbuck, reedbuck, elephant, hippo and much more. name: Ntemwa-Busanga Camp
description: Ntemwa-Busanga Camp is a seasonal bush camp on the southern edge of the famed Busanga Plains. Our classic thatched safari chalets (new for 2022!) accommodate just 6 guests, each chalet is accompanied by open-air en-suite bathrooms at the rear, with flushing toilets and warm bucket showers. The main area supplies a modest amount of power for charging cameras and other devices. ​ The main area overlooks the Busanga Plains, where wildebeest and zebra can be seen from camp. This area of the Kafue is known as the southern tree line and is comprised of woodland and open plains, which is a good habitat for wildlife sightings of all kinds. Cheetah move seasonally on to the plains as the grasses dry out and can be spotted more often when the wildebeest begin to give birth. Ntemwa-Busanga Plains Camp has access to a vast road network covering the expanse of the Busanga Plains and southern treelines. Zambia is one of few places where night drives are permitted and all our vehicles are equipped with spotlights and red-filters. Perfect to spot nocturnal animals! The wildlife of the Busanga Plains is as varied as it is numerous. Regional specials such as roan antelope and sable antelope are common sightings here. Along with thousands of red lechwe there is no shortage of game to view and photograph. Busanga Plains is also home to some of the largest herds of buffalo in the park, with numbers over 600, a sight to behold. The Southern Plains areas are home to wildebeest and zebra, along with herds of the diminutive oribi and secretive reedbuck. Of course the predators are here too, with a dominant lion pride, the ‘Papyrus Pride’ resident to the wetter plains in the north and both the Moshi and Lufupa prides utilizing the areas to the north and south of Ntemwa-Busanga camp. Leopard are here too, especially along the treeline of the plains, the same area that offers cheetah sightings from time to time and late season wild dog sightings.

description: In the heart of a vast grassland where the skies are endless and wildlife roams free, lies Time + Tide King Lewanika, Zambia’s most exclusive lodge. With panoramic views and an effortless flow between inside and outside, every luxury villa immerses you into the land. Handsome accents contrast with organic materials and honey-toned textiles inspired by the grass, creating a stylish haven. Relax on your deck and watch as wading birds tiptoe through the lagoon and lechwe drink. Listen to the chorus of birds and crickets as you rise with the sun and fall asleep under a million stars to the sound of whooping hyenas. Venture across the wildflower covered savannah in search of lions, cheetahs and Africa’s second biggest wildebeest migration, or take to the seasonal flood plain by canoe and surround yourself with a dazzling abundance and diversity of birds. Explore on foot to reconnect with the land and experience Liuwa as the Lozi people do, learning about their rich cultural heritage.

description: Mukalya Private Game Reserve is the ultimate luxury bush experience, located in a scenic location along the mighty Zambezi 180Km from Lusaka. It is directly opposite the Hurungwe Safari Area that allows for sightings of elephants, lions, buffalo, and other game as well as the magical sounds in the early hours of the morning and evening. The pristine location and Mukalya Private Game Reserve offer a safe experience to walk with game, experience a comfortable and luxurious stay without all the people! Accommodating 18 guests comfortably, Mukalya offers you a once in a lifetime opportunity to experience the bush in a unique and private setting that with all the lavish attention to detail. Our grand entrance, central living, and main dining area overlooks the Zambezi River with lots of open views and fresh air to maximize the connection with nature. The design of the reserve has incorporated lots of natural elements from the area such as all the pebble work on the walls and wood features from the woodlands nearby. Our oval swimming pool is situated on the edge of the riverbank with outstanding views, under our shady Acacia Tree canopies. The pool has a curved edge seating and pool loungers for those looking for a relaxing spot in the sun. Accommodation at Mukalya is in 9 uniquely designed rooms, completely renovated in 2020 with a design focused on supporting local craftsmanship and incorporating nature. All rooms are situated on the bank along the Zambezi River.

name: Bongwe Kafue Camp
description: Join us to discover one of Zambia's best-kept secrets: Hidden away in the Northern Kafue, our safari conservancy has only recently been opened to tourism and benefits from 15 years of privately funded & managed anti-poaching operations which has created a veritable Garden of Eden. In this setting, Bongwe offers you a truly original safari experience. Our home is Bongwe Bush Camp, nestled on the banks of the Kafue River on the boundary of the Kafue National Park. The Kafue is the largest national park in Zambia covering an area of 22,400km² (Similar to the size of Wales or Massachusetts). It's the second largest park in Africa and is home to a recorded 158 different species of Mammals. Our Bongwe Bush Camp is an exclusive, privately owned conservancy . Bongwe offers a unique, fun and AFFORDABLE quality safari. The conservancy has only just been opened as a tourism destination and the 15 years of privately managed anti-poaching and game management has created an environment unlike anywhere else in the country. Abundant wildlife habitats this Garden of Eden and populations of rare species are in plentiful supply. In contrast to the lower-lying, more commercial parks, Kafue supports a wide range of species unequalled anywhere else in Zambia. The park boasts of 158 mammal species recorded (so far) and there are 494 birds listed on the park list. We are the only safari camp within this vast area and pride ourselves on offering our guests an experience of days gone by, with possible sightings of large herds of Sable and Roan antelopes adding value to a destination that also features Cheetah, Lion, Leopard, Wild Dogs, Hyena, Jackal, Buffalo, Elephant, Hartebeest, Reid Buck, Oribi, Blue Duiker and Bush Pigs, to name but a few. With exclusive rights and a maximum of 8 guests, our highly professional and experienced guides will take you on a safari experience locked in time. Offering unspoiled privacy and authentic safari you will enjoy a secluded and beautiful paradise. The clear Kafue River meanders through the unspoilt bush, past our idyllic camp, and the serenity of the area truly captures the glory of an Africa completely wild. BONGWES DO IT IN THE BUSH
address: Delai, Mushengashi Conservancy, Kafue National Park 10101 Zambia

The trick to the showers is that you first turn the knob on the left (the hot one) several times then wait. It may take a few minutes for the water to come out. Then you turn the right knob (cold) several times plus another turn, then you wait until the water is the right temperature and adjust accordingly. If it is too hot, you have turned the left knob too far and need to turn it almost completely off but not totally to adjust to the right temperature. It's simple once you get the hang of it, but for the first shower it is confusing.
The wifi transmitter is near the outdoor kitchen, you'll get the best signal if you're not in the back of the rear building.

name: Munyamadzi Game Reserve
description: Munyamadzi is a 18,500 ha private wildlife reserve in the Lower Luangwa Valley with splendid flora and fauna, exquisite views of the Bulonga Hills and resounding tranquillity. With just one camp and low-volume tourism, this is a destination for a true adventure in the real African wilderness. Chalets are spread under large trees on the banks of the Luangwa River with exquisite views of the Bulonga Hills. Accommodation is simple yet comfortable, using natural building materials from nearby to keep you in touch with nature during your stay. We can take up to 10 guests, self-catering or full board. Family friendly, no age restrictions. Pizza oven, braai area and open air kitchen. Plunge pool. WiFi. Game drives, walking safaris, birding, fishing, project excursions. Six classic chalets are laid out on untamed grounds that wake you up to beautiful and interactive bird life setting it off to the most immaculate sunsets and star gazing nights. name: Sungani Lodge

The entire lodge is built on elevated decking. The relaxed ambiance is complimented by al fresco dining, cosy bar area and lounging areas that melt into the incredible view. Limited to seven luxury custom designed airconditioned guest tents set atop polished concrete floors offering approximately 1150 square feet indoors with an adjoining deck and private plunge pool. . The inclusive transfer to the properties is a short 20-minute flight from Mfuwe in the Sungani aircraft. Exclusive game viewing activities include game drives, walking safaris, bush meals, sundowners, day trips (on request), water excursions, photographic hides, and more.

description: Founded in 2019, Chula Island Camp is located on Katengahumba Island, separated from the mainland by the famed canoeing area, the ‘Discovery’ channel. This secretive and private Island gives unparalleled views over the Zambezi River. The wilderness experience and wildlife viewing are second to none. Chula Island Camp is a stunning tented camp with all the luxuries one could wish for, but with the charm and ethos of a true seasonal bush-camp. With just 5 guest tents, catering for no more than 10 people in camp at once - each tent is carefully and expertly located for the best possible views across the Zambezi River. The Chula tents are bespoke and very comfortable, with high quality linen and mattresses, alongside flushing toilets, running water taps and traditional bucket-showers! A main area stretch-canvas tent set beneath massive Natal Mahogany trees makes for an exceptional location for meals, reading, charging cameras and wildlife watching. Simply put, the Lower Zambezi has some of the finest big game wildlife viewing in Africa. This, coupled with the variety of safari activities on offer and the aesthetics of this park, make for a truly fantastic wildlife spectacle. High densities of elephant gather on the valley floor as the dry season commences, along with large herds of buffalo and impala. In attendance are all of the large predators one might expect, with lion, leopard and wild dog very well represented here. The only notable omission might be the giraffe, but a night-time safari scouting for honey badger and aardvark should help you forget about our long-necked friends!

name: Zambezi Kulefu Camp
locationString: Lower Zambezi National Park, Lusaka Province
description: Sanctuary Zambezi Kulefu Camp is an authentic safari camp, gathered around an acacia tree -shaded Bedouin-style central tent. The Lower Zambezi, the park in which the camp is located, is dominated by the Zambezi River which channels game into a narrow floodplain, resulting in unparalleled viewing opportunities. Arriving at the camp by boat from the local airstrip is a thrill as there is usually plenty of game to see on the way, and travelling to camp becomes part of the safari adventure.The seven spacious tents are set on teak platforms made from commercially grown forests and all have spectacular views over the river. Each tent has its own lounge area and viewing deck. Carved wooden tables and woven chairs complement the four-poster beds and canvas walls - this is camping taken to its most luxurious heights.

name: Blue Nile Inn Long Acres
description: Located in a quiet part of Longacres in Lusaka, Zambia, the Blue Nile Inn offers 16 fully equipped double rooms. Situated opposite the United Nations headquarters in Longacres, Blue Nile Inn accommodation offers a serene environment and is built in a motel like shape to offer complete privacy. The inn has 16 well-appointed double rooms. The rooms are spacious with simple but effective decor. All rooms are fully serviced and are cleaned every morning to ensure that the guests return to a clean and fresh environment. Laundry services are available to guests at the lodge. Room service and wakeup call services are available upon request. The lodge has conference facilities ideal for business meetings and private functions. There is also a fully stocked bar with a wide variety of beverages to choose from. The Blue Nile Inn offers plenty of space to socialize and relax with well-kept lawns and specially made chalets where guests can enjoy a drink or a braai (bbq). Staff members at Blue Nile Inn are friendly, efficient and are dedicated to ensuring that guests experience the most pleasant stay possible. The Blue Nile Inn is a great location for those looking for peace and quiet after a long day of work.

name: Nsunge Nsunge Farm & Natural Resort
description: Welcome to Nsunge Nsunge Farm and Natural Resort. We are are a green farm and natural resort powered by renewable solar technology offering the following services and solutions. Two and one Bedroomed Apartments and Villas with free game viewing in the quiet bush and natural environment a few kilometers away from the city. You can see game animals from the comfort of your room. Day visit and game viewing. We are the first and only farm and resort open to the public with the rare species ; Black Impala; in Zambia. Conferencing, workshops and events in the bush and natural environment with full view of game animals including the rare black Impala. Restaurant and Bar in the bush and natural environment. Come and enjoy our meals, drinks and watch your favourite soccer team on TV in the bush and natural environment while looking at our game animals including the rare black Impala. Photoshoots in the bush and natural environment with game animals Zebras, Common Duicker, Impala and the rare Black Impala. Come and take your memorable wedding, birthday, graduation ,family photos e.t.c in the bush natural environment with our game animals and the rare Black Impala.

name: Time + Tide Chongwe Suites
description: Named after indigenous plants growing in the area, the Cassia and Albida Suites are nestled under ancient towering trees at the confluence of the Chongwe and Zambezi Rivers. The one-bedroom Cassia Suite is a private suite for two, perfect for honeymooners and couples. The two-bedroom, two-bathroom Albida Suite sleeps four guests and is great for families wanting their own space or friends travelling together. Both have en-suite open air bathrooms with a clawfoot bath, a canopied lounge and dining area, a pool overlooking the river, a fire pit and a dedicated butler. Dine privately in your suite or in the main camp lounge on the riverbank, enjoying cuisine that celebrates local seasonal ingredients. Notice how much better your nightcap tastes when it’s served in a crystal glass by the fire. Lower Zambezi National Park is known for the variety of activities on offer, including game drives, walking safaris, canoeing safaris, boat cruises and tiger fishing. The Albida Suite includes privately-guided activities.

Accommodation, conferencing and events facilities all at your disposal in one place! We are beautifully situated on the uphill were you can enjoy the sun rise on the Lake Bangweulu and sun set while you enjoy the scenery of Samfya. some few Meters down is the Lake Bangweulu and White Sandy Beach.

name: Riverview Lodge & Wellness Centre
description: If you are looking to DETOX, RECOVER & DECOMPRESS, then Riverview Wellness Centre is the perfect holiday destination for you. Our goal is to transform your life, and put you on the path to wellness and health. Riverview Wellness Centre is a resort gives you a window to better health. Through a combination of treatments, massage, dietary changes and exercise. Riverview Lodge is ideally situated for a getaway from the big city, or for travellers on their way to Livingstone looking to experience more of what Zambia has to offer. We are on a lovely campus and farm of over 1,100 hectares reaching from the Kafue River along the rocky escarpment and into the distance. The bright green of banana plantations contrast nicely against the deep green of new avocado plantations and the sweeping views across the centre pivots full of windblown wheat or soya. Large old growth forests still cover large parts of the property providing cool shaded walks from the intense African heat.

description: We are located in the CBD of Ndola! Our cozy 2-two bedroomed apartments are a must-see, with fully furnished living rooms, kitchens, and bedrooms. Our self-contained master bedrooms are a must-see!. We offer high-speed internet, emergency lights, and UPS for the TV and internet. Ideal for working from home!A 24-hour gap between guests for proper cleaning and sanitizing. A walking distance to major food chains like Shoprite, Pick n Pay, and fast food Hungry Lion. The Copperbelt Museum is a must-see just a breezy 7-minute walk and you’re in for a treat for those visiting from outside the country. A walking distance of major financial institutions and government offices. And for those visiting out of town wanting to experience the nightlife and fine dining, we are located 2KM from the exciting nightlife and fine dining at Kafubu Mall and other exciting places.We offer great rates for those staying for a while .
